Key Match Events: Tyrese Haliburton scored 27 points and Myles Turner added 20 points, six rebounds and three blocks, leading the Indiana Pacers past the Phoenix Suns 126-108.
Haliburton also had eight assists and, for the second straight game, did not commit a turnover.
Kevin Durant led the Suns with 25 points, seven rebounds and seven assists, while Devin Booker had 20 points, nine rebounds, and nine assists.
The Pacers swung the game by breaking a 56-all halftime tie with the first five points of the second half and used a pivotal 40-point third quarter to seize control.
Indiana capped its big third quarter with a late 12-5 run that extended an eight-point lead to 96-82.
Post-Match Reflections: Suns: Phoenix continues to create consternation over what’s wrong. Booker, Durant and Bradley Beal were supposed to form the nucleus of a title contender. Instead, they’ve lost seven of eight and 10 of 13, forcing coach Mike Budenholzer to continue waiting for career win No. 500.

Pacers: Indiana has finally started playing the way it envisioned over these past 11 games. Haliburton is in sync, the defense has improved and the Pacers have won eight times during that span to reach .500.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Indiana had 35 assists on 46 baskets and only six turnovers while outrebounding the Suns 47-37.
